name: King Kooker Cooking Oil Filter Pump

reviews.name: King Kooker Cooking Oil Filter Pump
reviews.reviewText: This product has been made very cheaply. the battery compartment won't stay closed. the filter bulb comes off the main stem. Don't buy!
reviews.title: Lousy oil filter

reviews.name: King Kooker Cooking Oil Filter Pump
reviews.reviewText:
The idea is good but not worth the $31. I would value it at more like $4-$5. The electrical battery connections are poorly designed. After fooling with it for more than an hour, I did get it to run for about15 seconds and the small motor sounded as if it were laboring. (too much load)
The product is NOT reliable for public use. It needs to go back to the bench and clean up the fit and finish of the electrical connections, motor and shaft alignment and reliability.
reviews.title: Did not work out of the box.

reviews.name: King Kooker Cooking Oil Filter Pump
reviews.reviewText: If you ever had to filter 30 gallons of cooking oil with a ladle and a cone type filter you will love this. Its not the fastest being that its battery operated but it took alot less time than the way I had been doing it. Wal Mart doesn't sell replacement filters so I hope they're available thru King Kooker.
reviews.title: King Kooker Cooking Oil Filter

reviews.name: King Kooker Cooking Oil Filter Pump
reviews.reviewText: This product did not even come close to doing what it was suppose to. Not 1 drop of oil ever came out of the plastic drain tube. It was not powerfull enough to pull the oil thru the plastic tube. I would not recommend this item for anyone at any price. It was a waste of $26.00 plus tax
reviews.title: oil pump

reviews.name: King Kooker Cooking Oil Filter Pump
reviews.reviewText: did not work, ordered 2nd, did not work
reviews.title: worthless
